subtitle.Text: So there's this little scrap of paper that's hidden under this bedside table, and you start to read it, and then Katie makes you stop reading it.
And it was this thing where... it's an exception to the interactive expectations that you have,
it's one place, I guess THE one place, where we really impinge on your ability as a player to do what you want, and Katie intervenes, basically?
And it was something that I thought was an interesting little one-off way of emphasizing the difference between the player and the character that they're playing as,
and to you as a player, the note's just a note, but a reminder that Sam is Katie's sister, and Katie wouldn't want to read this thing, and she's not going to keep doing it even if you want her to.
